page.title: 15BLACK BOURTON VILLAGE
page.content: The village has an entry in the{ {Domesday Book}under{Burton Abbots. {Black Friars}from{Osney Abbey}are thought to have worked in the Manor farm area and lodged at{Burton},giving the village its name. Today it is a small community of about 200 people. The 60 children of school age receive their education from neighbouring towns & villages. They have a local playground but no village shop. The old cottages retain their character & some are still bundle thatched. A {village association}has been set up to develop the community spirit of the village. The church of{St.Mary The {Virgin}was given to Osney Abbey in {1180.}It contains{13th Century Murals. The vicar lives at Shilton and looks after 5 churches altogether. The graveyard was extended for Carterton burials & has a military section too.
